metadata.Title: CVE-2017-16042 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Growl adds growl notification support to nodejs. Growl before 1.10.2 doesnot properly sanitize input before passing it to exec, allowing forarbitrary command execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-16042` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

node-growl - 1.10.5-2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: node-growl package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.5-2').
